Docs.summary: Initializes OpenTK. This method is necessary only if you are using OpenTK alongside a different windowing toolkit (e.g. GTK#) and should be the very first method called by your application (i.e. calling this method should be the very first statement executed by the "Main" method).
Docs.remarks: Some windowing toolkits do not configure the underlying platform correctly or configure it in a way that is incompatible with OpenTK. Calling this method first ensures that OpenTK is given the chance to initialize itself and configure the platform correctly.
